action.action-desc: Ms. Manning introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To limit cost-sharing for prescription drugs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Capping Prescription Costs Act of 2023.

subsection.text: Section 1302(c) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (42 U.S.C. 18022(c)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3)(A)(i), by inserting , including cost-sharing with respect to prescription drugs covered by the plan after charges; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: For plan years beginning in 2025, the cost-sharing incurred under a health plan with respect to prescription drugs covered by the plan shall not exceed $250 per month for each enrolled individual, or $500 for each family.

clause.text: In the case of any plan year beginning in a calendar year after 2025, the limitation under this paragraph shall be equal to the applicable dollar amount under subparagraph (A) for plan years beginning in 2025, increased by an amount equal to the product of that amount and the medical care component of the consumer price index for all urban consumers (as published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics) for that year.
If the amount of any increase under clause (i) is not a multiple of $5, such increase shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $5.

subsection.text: Section 2707(b) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300gg–6(b)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking paragraph (1) of section 1302(c) and inserting paragraphs (1) and (5) of section 1302(c) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsections (a) and (b) shall take effect with respect to plans beginning after December 31, 2024.
